Eh; On the one hand I don't see it being used for regular transistors, but on the other hand while it's not a quantum using the premise of quantum computing (as in using subatomic particles to do computing) with the particle = jesus christ.

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55b1342f63687224c000048c#post_55b1342f63687224c000048c

So essentially a photon, we can see it and see it's effects on different surfaces but not directly use it?
topics.author: 4fdfbf92945b7075d50036e4

topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55b134a163687252cb000aa6#post_55b134a163687252cb000aa6
Not exactly; photons while they travel in straight lines the reason why they travel in straight lines is because they're a wave-particle duality.  The new particle is completely a particle; imagine playing pool where the pool table is a hard surface and you cover all the pool balls in astroglide.

topics.body:
So my friend's business won't let us advertise the fundraiser because it's apparently against "store policy". Which kinda sucks because their absolute busiest day is in two days. On one hand, I respect their decision because it's their business, but on the other hand, it stings a bit. 

Am I talking too much about this? I'm sorry, guys, I'm just trying so hard to make this easier on his family, so it's been on my mind a lot.
